title: HTML - Using Multiple iframes + a sidebar, how to better format
body:
I am complete novice when it comes to HTML, CSS, JS, etc. This is my first time making a website that has "moving" parts per say. I have been asking a lot of questions but now I come for just general advice - I am looking to learn.

The website displays information that I gather from running a python script.

I was instructed to add a sidebar that displayed information such as testlines with sub categories such as builds and underneath those the dates each time the build was ran.

Upon the example of this W3.css Tutorial I created the sidebar. But upon asking questions earlier I learned that giving the sidebar a fixed with and then setting the "left-margin" to the div next to it to the same length of the sidebar is ill advised. It makes all the elements depend on each other instead of being independent. Is there a better way for me to format the sidebar while maintaining a similar look? Here is the code I have:

<div class="w3-sidebar w3-bar-block w3-light-grey w3-card-2" style="width:160px;">

    <button class="w3-button w3-block w3-left-align" onclick="myAccFunc('demoAcc')">
      Accordian1
      <i class="fa fa-caret-down"></i>
    </button>

    <div id="demoAcc" class="w3-hide w3-white w3-card-2">
      <a href="#" class="w3-bar-item w3-button">Link</a>
      <a href="#" class="w3-bar-item w3-button">Link</a>
    </div>

    <button class="w3-button w3-block w3-left-align" onclick="myAccFunc('demo2Acc')">
      Accordion <i class="fa fa-caret-down"></i>
    </button>



    <div id="demo2Acc" class="w3-hide w3-white w3-card-2">
      <a href="#" class="w3-bar-item w3-button">testingtesting</a>
      <a href="#" class="w3-bar-item w3-button">dadsfasd</a>
      <button class="w3-button w3-block w3-left-align" onclick="myAccFunc('nested')">
        another acc <i class="fa fa-caret-down"></i>
      </button>
    </div>

On top of this now my website is just a bunch of iframes stitched together. One iframe to display the information on the right of the sidebar and within that iframe, an iframe to hold the graphs that are on the webpage.

Here is an example of what I am talking about:

From the main index.html file I have:

 <div class="box" , id='shorts'>
    <iframe class='d' src='othersite.html' id='bg' onload='autoResize("bg")'></iframe>
  </div>

The "othersite.html" has code that looks like:

<div class = "box">
    <iframe class = 'd' src='graphs.html' id = 'beautifulgraphs' onload='autoResize("beautifulgraphs")'></iframe>
</div>

To me using this iframe within iframe approach seems unnecessary and at times - extremely ineffective.

Here is the link to a plunker of my current website format

Any and all advice would be extremely appreciated.

My main questions that I am in search of answers for are:

  1. How do I move away from giving the sidebar a width and then giving the div next to the sidebar a margin?
  2. Is there a better organization than iframes within iframes?
